title: $:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: Editor Clipboard
readme: !! Clipboard Plugin This plugin adds some handy elements to the editor interface of TiddlyWiki. Via settings you can control the appearance of: * two additional fields to store universally accessible information * five editor toolbar buttons (with friendly background color) ** show/hide clipboard: ctrl+shift+C ** show/hide preview: ctrl+shift+V ** insert text: ctrl+shift+1 ** insert title link: ctrl+shift+2 ** insert title transclusion: ctrl+shift+3 * a copy-title button ** {{$:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard/TitleTemplate!!description}}: ctrl+shift+T Via the plugin’s settings you have full control over all elements, so you can use a selection that fits in your workflow. Now see what they can do for you! !!! Clipboard Field Below the tags of the tiddler you can access the //Clipboard//. Here you store information you wish to access from other tiddlers you will edit later. This field is like a window to another independent tiddler: the clipboard tiddler. It is saved whenever the wiki is saved. It’s content can be inserted in the tiddlers text by clicking a button (see below). !!! Title Clipboard Field Here you can store – well, the title of a tiddler. You can insert it in any other tiddler you edit later on with the click of a single button – as a link or as a transclusion (see below). !!! Copy-Title Button Next to the title input field resides a button that copies the title of your draft to the //Title Clipboard//. !!! Editor Toolbar Buttons Show up to five buttons in the editor toolbar: * {{$:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard/icons/unfold}} Show/Hide clipboard fields * {{$:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard/icons/file}} Show/Hide clipboard preview: if you have stored a transclusion in your //Clipboard//, this button will produce a preview of the rendered content. Maybe you want to copy from there? Ort try to transclude `{{$:/AdvancedSearch}}` in the //Clipboard//. Very useful. * {{$:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard/icons/clip}} Insert text from clipboard: transfers the //Clipboard’s// content to the position of the cursor in the editor. * {{$:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard/icons/link}} Insert clipboard title as link: puts the content of the //Title Clipboard// in double square brackets and places the result at the cursor position. * {{$:/plugins/telmiger/Clipboard/icons/transclude}} Insert clipboard title as transclusion: the same as above, but with curly brackets. !!! Tips for Advanced Users * Want to test a filter? Put `{{$:/AdvancedSearch}}` in your clipboard and use the fully functional preview. No need to leave your workspace. * Want to see the source (wikitext) of another tiddler? Put an `<$edit-text …/>` widget in the clipboard and preview … * Would you rather have a preview of your work as an overlay instead of side-by-side? Write `{{Draft of 'Your Tiddler Title'}}` in the clipboard – et voilà!

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons
author: Thomas Elmiger
description: Save & close / Cancel & close / Save & keep open
name: EditButtons
readme:
!! The Plugin {{$:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/about}} --- !!! Versions !!!! 1.0.6 * Spelling correction, thanks Mat! !!!! 1.0.5 – Inspired by Mat <:-) * toolbar configuration added to settings * revised CSS, additional icon style * renamed icons and buttons to move them into the plugin namespace !!!! 1.0.4 * settings, new styles and license added * refactoring of icons and CSS !!!! 1.0.3 * update for TW version 5.1.22 !!!! 1.0.2 * simpler button graphics (single svg) * simpler CSS (tiddler renamed) * documentation update !!!! 0.1.5 * control colours via CSS * much cleaner construction using class names ** edit-btn-icon (in variants cancel-close, save-close, save-open) ** tc-mini-icon --- !!! Plugin components * buttons ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/Buttons/cancel-and-close ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/Buttons/save-and-close ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/Buttons/save-open * button graphics ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/images/done-close-button ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/images/cancel-close-button ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/images/done-open-button * SVG ** $:/core/images/done-button – a slightly modified core button.
Original: <$transclude tiddler="$:/core" subtiddler="$:/core/images/done-button"/> => {{$:/core/images/done-button}} * Hints and Captions you could translate ** $:/language/Buttons/Cancel-Close/Hint ** $:/language/Buttons/Cancel-Close/Caption ** $:/language/Buttons/Save-Close/Hint ** $:/language/Buttons/Save-Close/Caption ** $:/language/Buttons/Save-Open/Hint ** $:/language/Buttons/Save-Open/Caption * CSS ** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/styles.css *** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/styles/coloured.css *** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/styles/light.css *** $:/plugins/telmiger/EditButtons/styles/standard.css

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/EditorCounter
author: Thomas & Jed
name: EditorCounter
readme:
!! Count Your Texts & Autosave {{$:/plugins/telmiger/EditorCounter/about}} !!! The counters * In edit mode users can see stats concerning the tiddler’s text and title fields. The numbers are updated whenever they pause typing. * Counters for //words// and/or //characters// can be activated in the plugin settings. * The colours of the counters change at some predefined numbers. ** Settings for colors and color limits are not available in the plugin configuration.
Workaround: edit [[the template|$:/plugins/telmiger/EditorCounter/EditTemplate]]. !!! Autosave * When activated in the [[plugin settings|$:/plugins/telmiger/EditorCounter/settings]], //autosave// will try to save the wiki in the background during editing: whenever a predefined number of characters has been added or removed, a save is triggered. ** As an option you can show a checkbox in the editor to pause/activate automatic saving. !!! Parameters |!Parameter |!Description | |colors |Optionally, define an array of color and number pairs to set minimal color limits. | |colorState |Optional state tiddler to save the color value. | |field |Calculate for the text in this field. | |mode |Entity to calculate: //word// or //character// or //autosave//. Defaults to "character". | |savelimit |A number of character changes after which //autosave// is performed. Default value: 200 | |text |Calculate this text. | |tiddler |Optional title of a tiddler to take the field from. Defaults to current tiddler. | !!! Widget usage This plugin is based on a similar [[solution by Jed Carty|$:/plugins/telmiger/EditorCounter/credits]] – many thanks! The widget can be used in other contexts than the plugin. The usage would be very similar to [[Jed’s examples on ooktech.com|http://ooktech.com/jed/ExampleWikis/WordCount/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Finmysocks%2FWordCount%2FWord%20Count%20Widget]] Known differences: instead of `<$word-count` start with `<$editor-counter`. Default mode is //character//. !!!! Widget examples ``` <$editor-counter tiddler=SomeTiddler field=some_field mode=word/> <$editor-counter tiddler=SomeTiddler mode=character colors="blue:10,green:50,red:100"/> <$editor-counter text="some text string" mode=character colorState="$:/state/someTextColor" colors="blue:10,green:50"/> <$editor-counter mode=autosave savelimit=300/> ```

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: HarveyBalls
readme:
\define tr(variant,nr:"") <$vars tit="$:/language/HarveyBalls/$variant$/title" desc="$:/language/HarveyBalls/$variant$/desc" nr="""$nr$"""> {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/$variant$/icon.svg}} <><$link to=<>><$transclude tiddler=<>/> <$link to=<>><$transclude tiddler=<>/> \end !! Harvey Balls Harvey Balls are round ideograms used for visual communication of qualitative information. They are commonly used in comparison tables to indicate the degree to which a particular item meets a particular criterion. !!! Macros for display The same as `{{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/half/icon.svg}}` – the Harvey ball <> – would be displayed for all three of the following macros: `<>` `<>` `<>` Titles or numbers of the following tables can be used. !!! Available ideograms //1) more colour is better// <> <> <> <> <>
icon # title desc
//2) less colour is better// <> <> <> <> <>
icon # title desc
!!! Adapt or translate for better accessibility To convey another meaning with your Harvey Balls, it is possible to adapt or translate titles and descriptions. So it is possible to use them e.g. for a performance ratings or a score like: * poor * fair * good * very good * excellent Just click the text in the table above and adapt the content to your needs. The warning is just a reminder that you are overwriting the standard text. You can always delete your own version to return to the original. !!! Control dimensions via font size Inside surrounding text, the Harvey balls adapt themselves in size. Examples: ! Title H1 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/empty/icon.svg}} !! Title H2 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/full/icon.svg}} more text !!! Title H3 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/quarter/icon.svg}} more text !!!! Title H4 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/half/icon.svg}} more text Normal text paragraph {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/quarter-empty/icon.svg}} more text or apply [[styling via Wikitext|http://tiddlywiki.com/#Styles%20and%20Classes%20in%20WikiText]]: @@font-size:2em; You will need some text {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/full/icon.svg}} to make this big. @@ !!! Adjust colours via CSS The styling of the balls can be changed # by adapting the style sheet $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/icons.css # by adapting surrounding text color in case of the //less colour is better// version (it uses fill="currentColor")

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory
author: Thomas Elmiger
description: MyStory – replacement sidebar tab for Open
name: MyStory
readme:
!! My Story A story list on steroids. Adds bookmarking and alternative labels for story-elements in sidebar tabs: * The [[MyMarks|$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/bookmarks/tab]] tab shows links to bookmarked elements. * The [[MyStory|$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/tab]] tab can replace the //Open// tab: The listing shows the title of a tiddler, if there is no caption field, the caption, if there is no other field as defined below. – `title` might be a good fallback :) !!! [[Usage settings|$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/settings]] Control active sidebar tabs:
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/tab" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> <$text text={{$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/tab!!caption}}/>   <$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/bookmarks/tab" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> <$text text={{$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/bookmarks/tab!!caption}}/>   <$checkbox tiddler="$:/core/ui/SideBar/Open" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> {{$:/core/ui/SideBar/Open!!caption}}
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/core/ui/SideBar/Recent" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> {{$:/core/ui/SideBar/Recent!!caption}}   <$checkbox tiddler="$:/core/ui/SideBar/Tools" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> {{$:/core/ui/SideBar/Tools!!caption}}   <$checkbox tiddler="$:/core/ui/SideBar/More" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> {{$:/core/ui/SideBar/More!!caption}} Show small buttons for every list entry:
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/settings" index="show-edit-button" checked="yes" unchecked="no"> edit button
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/settings" index="show-clone-button" checked="yes" unchecked="no"> clone button {{$:/core/ui/ControlPanel/Settings/DefaultSidebarTab}} Click the tag and arrange tabs via drag and drop:
<> !! In-Story Controls Elements tagged <> can be added below every element (tiddler) in the story.
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/MyStory/settings" index="in-story-controls" checked="show" unchecked="hide"> show in-story controls

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode
author: Thomas Elmiger
description: ReaderMode – a nice, clean reading experience
name: ReaderMode
readme:
!! Reader Mode ''Display the story river as a flow of content, without any meta info or functions. A nice, clean document for reading.'' To support the impression of one single frame, the background of the story is set to the same colour as the tiddler background. This plugin provides two buttons: * The ''Reader mode button'' {{$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/toggle}} to hide elements of your choice (see configuration below) that usually separate tiddlers in the story: ** tiddler frame, border and shadow ** title and buttons (tiddler controls) ** subtitle (date and author/modifier) ** tags * The ''Drag mode button'' {{$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/drag}} to enable and disable dragging of elements within/from the story: ** drag an element within the story to positions nearby ** drag from story to sidebar or from sidebar to story to bring elements to distant positions ** elements are always moved (not duplicated) !!! Button configuration Where to show the Drag Mode button:
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/drag" tag="$:/tags/TopLeftBar"> Top left bar
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/drag" tag="$:/tags/TopRightBar"> Top right bar
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/drag" tag="$:/tags/PageControls"> Page controls Where to show the Reader Mode button:
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/toggle" tag="$:/tags/TopLeftBar"> Top left bar
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/toggle" tag="$:/tags/TopRightBar"> Top right bar
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/toggle" tag="$:/tags/PageControls"> Page controls !!! Story configuration By default, the button {{$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/ui/Buttons/toggle}} hides/shows tiddler titles and subtitles (author and timestamp) via CSS. This way they are still present in the HTML code. Tiddler controls are displayed much smaller. Additionally you can exclude elements from being rendered at all in the next section. !!!! Exclude from rendering <$list filter="[all[shadows+tiddlers]tag[$:/tags/ViewTemplate]!title[$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/body]!list[$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/blocked]]"> <$checkbox tiddler="$:/temp/ReaderMode/dummy" field=<> checked="YES" unchecked="NO" default="NO" actions="""<$action-listops $tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/blocked" $subfilter=<> /><$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="$:/temp/ReaderMode/dummy"/>"""> <$text text={{!!title}}/>
--- <$list filter="[all[shadows+tiddlers]list[$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/blocked]]"> <$wikify name="unblock" text="-<>"> <$checkbox tiddler="$:/temp/ReaderMode/dummy" field=<> checked="YES" unchecked="NO" default="YES" actions="""<$action-listops $tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/blocked" $subfilter=<> /><$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="$:/temp/ReaderMode/dummy"/>"""> <$text text={{!!title}}/>
Excluding elements from rendering is possible using a modified [[view template|$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate]] and a [[list of blocked elements|$:/plugins/telmiger/ReaderMode/blocked]].

title: $:/plugins/JR-telmiger/StoryAdmin
author: Jan und Thomas
description: Story Admin – save and load story lists
name: StoryAdmin – save and load story lists
readme:
!! Story Admin

This plugin is based on [[slidesnstories|http://slidesnstories.tiddlyspot.com/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2FJR%2Fslidesnstories]] by Jan (JR). While the slides part was removed, some new features for dealing with stories were added.


!!! Admin panel

<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/JR-telmiger/StoryAdmin/tab" tag="$:/tags/SideBar"> Show tab in sidebar</$checkbox>


!!! Categories

Every story is saved as an entry in a category. (Technically: as a tiddler tagged with the respective category.)

<label>''Top category tag:'' <$edit-text tiddler="$:/plugins/JR-telmiger/StoryAdmin/settings" index="story-tag" size="20" tag="input"/></label>

Click the top category tag to see the available Categories: <$macrocall $name="tag" tag={{$:/plugins/JR-telmiger/StoryAdmin/settings##story-tag}}/>

To add a category, create a tiddler with this tag. Or add a category here: 

{{$:/plugins/JR-telmiger/StoryAdmin/category-new}}

!! Story Admin Macros

!!! Button to load a story

Replace the current story with the tiddlers saved in field //story// of a tiddler titled //Tiddler Title//:

`<<loadStoryBtn "Tiddler Title">>`

or as a macro call:

```
<$macrocall $name="loadStoryBtn" snap="Tiddler Title"/>
```

Shortcut for the tiddler the macro is in: 

`<<loadStoryButton>>` uses `{{!!title}}`


If there is no story, these macros return an error message.

!!! Button to append a story

Add the tiddlers saved in field //story// of a tiddler titled //Tiddler Title// to the bottom of the story:

`<<appendStoryBtn "Tiddler Title">>`

Also works as a macro call (see above).

If there is no story, this macro returns a hidden error message (invisible HTML span).

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/details
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: Disclosure HTML element
readme:
! ~DetailsWidget

A plugin for [[TiddlyWiki|http://tiddlywiki.com]] 5 containing a script and some styles to create an HTML 5 `<details>` section including a `<summary>`. Here’s an example:

<$details summary="W3C definition">

<<<
The [[details|http://w3c.github.io/html/interactive-elements.html#elementdef-details]] element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls.
<<< W3C

</$details>

Documentation can be found at http://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html#DetailsWidget

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/listreveal
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: Listreveal
readme:
!! Good to Know A list of things you should know about this plugin. Click the ellipsis button on the right […] to see more. Use this button to enable editing: <>

 

<$set name="listfilter" value="""[all[shadows]prefix[0]sort[title]]""">
    <$list filter=<>> <$set name="tidTitle" value={{!!title}}>
  • <$link to={{!!title}}><$view field="title"/> <> <$wikify name="cl" text=<> > <$wikify name="tt" text=<> > <$macrocall $name="listrevealButton" title=<> tooltip=<> close=<>/> <$wikify name="tpl" text=<> > <$macrocall $name="listrevealContent" title=<> datetime=<>/>
!! Version history !!! Version 0.3.30 * Fixed a bug on node.js, where ~$:/state tiddlers disappear on reload. * Search fields do no longer get automatic focus – configurable via listrevealSearch’s parameter (id:"search",focus:''"yes"'') * Plugin support tab and other minor improvements.

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/reminders
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: Reminders and Alerts
readme:
!! Readme 

This is a BETA version – there is no guarantee that the plugin works as expected!

!!! Alerts
While you are active in your wiki, an ''alert'' will pop up if …

* a deadline was set in the field specified in the //configuration// tab
* the deadline of a tiddler tagged "ToDo" has been missed.

!!! Reminders
This plugin can show a reminder before a deadline is reached. Set the time span for this in the //configuration// tab.

!!! Designed for ToDoNow
''//No alert or reminder//'' is shown for the task in the ''Do'' section tagged <<tag ToDoNow>> – it is assumed that you are working on it.

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/rpn
author: Thomas Elmiger
description: rpn – Basic Math in Reverse Polish Notation
name: rpn
readme:
!! Simple calculations {{$:/plugins/telmiger/rpn/about}} * the macro takes two operands (//a// and //b//) as input – this may be macros or transclusions ** operands are sent through a simplified [[wikify|http://tiddlywiki.com/#WikifyWidget]] function before calculation starts ** use //pi// to get π (Math.PI) * standard operations: +, -, /, * ** advanced operations: modulus (%) and rounding (optional: Math.floor or Math.ceil) * output formatting ** limit digits after comma (//decimals//), force //precision// display with //precision:"p"// (.toPrecision) ** //locale// formatting (.toLocaleString) * string concatenation (&) ** the resulting string is sent through the internal [[wikify|http://tiddlywiki.com/#WikifyWidget]] function * random numbers in a range from a to b with //precision:"r"// (including both a and b) !!! New: Wikitext Macros * calculate using filters and tiddler fields, see //fields// tab (since version 0.7.1) !!! Installation The plugin available on https://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html includes the documentation.
If you want the functionality only, you can drag this tiddler to your wiki: $:/plugins/telmiger/rpn/rpn.js – then save and reload. !!! Alternatives * [[TW mathematic filter operators (see tiddlywiki.com)|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Mathematics%20Operators]] * https://evanbalster.com/tiddlywiki/formulas.html – process numbers and other data just like popular spreadsheet software, with the additional flexibility of functional programming for those who need it * http://mathcell.tiddlyspot.com/ – tries to replace spreadsheet applications and uses some identical operators as rpn * http://tobibeer.github.io/tb5/#calc – does calculations based on tiddler fields * eval – calc combined with ''math.js'' – a heavy math library ** http://mklauber.github.io/tiddly-mathjs/ ** http://tobibeer.github.io/tw5-plugins/#math.js

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/simple-search
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: Simple Search
readme:
!! Simple Search 

{{$:/plugins/telmiger/simple-search/about}}


!!! Keyboard accessible

* Press <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>Cmd</kbd> + <kbd>Space</kbd> to ''launch'' or ''close'' Simple Search (or define your own shortcut [[in the control panel|$:/core/ui/ControlPanel/KeyboardShortcuts]]). 
* Navigate with <kbd>Tab</kbd>
** {{$:/core/ui/Buttons/advanced-search}} takes you to $:/AdvancedSearch
** the next <kbd>Tab</kbd> jumps to the search results.

Depending on your browser and settings, you can select a list item using <kbd>Tab</kbd> or <kbd>up</kbd> and <kbd>down</kbd> arrow keys, finally confirm your choice with <kbd>Enter</kbd>.


!!! Search in fields
Primary results are listed for tiddlers containing the search term in the ''title'' OR the ''caption'' fields. 

The secondary list finds results based on all other fields (not title nor caption). This can be adapted via settings.


!!! Create tiddlers

Empty result list? No problem. Create missing tiddlers using the search term as title and caption. 

* Hit <kbd>Tab</kbd> until you reach the plus button (+).
* Create a tiddler with <kbd>Enter</kbd>.

See template options on the ''settings tab''. – Hat tip to //Diego Mesa// for inspiring this feature.


!!! Settings

Make sure to visit the ''settings tab'' to adjust your preferences.


!! Core overruling

This plugin overwrites $:/core/ui/SideBarSegments/search and nothing else.

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/todonow
author: Thomas Elmiger
description: ToDoNow – a simple, elegant todo list
list: readme try-out usage configuration user-filter support
name: ToDoNow
readme:
!! Installation instructions See http://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html#ToDoNow%20Installation !!! ~ToDoNow needs Listreveal ToDoNow extends the power of another plugin called //listreveal// to produce lists. <$list filter="[all[shadows]title[$:/plugins/telmiger/listreveal/readme]!has[text]]"> [[Get Listreveal from tid.li/tw5/plugins.html|http://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html#Get%20More%20Plugins]] <$list filter="[all[shadows]title[$:/plugins/telmiger/listreveal/readme]has[text]]"> Read more about Listreveal: $:/plugins/telmiger/listreveal/readme !! Feedback Found a bug or a feature? Report in the [[Google Group|https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=de#!forum/tiddlywiki]]. --- !! Versions and updating You might want to delete tiddlers that override shadow tiddlers in the plugin. Go to the control panel, fold out the plugin using the down-arrow icon and open the contents tab. Tiddlers in bold are o.k. Tiddlers with names in normal style are dangerous and you might have to delete them to get the new version from the updated plugin. !!! Version 1.2.15 * Fixed a bug on node.js, where ~$:/state tiddlers disappear on reload . * Added support tab and other minor improvements. !!! Version 1.2.9 * Minor redesign with better icons, context sensitive colours, less whitespace and additional configuration options: ** hide the header of ToDoNow ** check and adjust author/creator info and task template ** translate all text, date and time formats on ToDoNow via translation tiddlers *** you can leave the translation empty to save the space * independent save button (no longer a duplication of the core save button, so [[adding an accesskey to the core version|https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/tiddlywiki/OJQ0yRq4zog/DqCXRmWxAgAJ]] should not be a problem anymore) * listreveal updated to version 0.3.21 * reminders updated to version 0.1.6 Special thanks to Surya, Mark, Jasper and Josiah for feedback and suggestions! !!! Version 1.0.9 * Quotes – single ' and double " – can be used in task titles now (do not put " at the end though)
//hint: a prime ′ is not a straight-apostrophe ' or a printer's apostrophe ’// * listreveal updated to version 0.2.1 * reminders updated to version 0.1.4 !!! Version 1.0.8 * User filters are back – better than ever * Configuration info update – how to translate/adjust date and time formats !!! Version 1.0.7 * New Addon: Outlook ** Outlook shows tasks for today/tomorrow/next 7 days – comes with translations en, de, dk * Support for new/updated Plugins ** Reminders: https://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html ** [[Datepicker|http://kixam.github.io/TW5-datePicker/]] 0.5.2 and moments.js [[(info)|http://momentjs.com/]] 2.18.1 by kixam ** [[Checklist by Tony Grosinger|http://grosinger.net/tw5-checklist/]] in the great new version 0.0.14 *** hint: use tab and space bar to navigate, activate and delete subtasks *** (removed unnecessary CSS) * Download options ** Bundles for simple to sophisticated solutions ** Demo/download page for the complete solution: https://tid.li/tw5/tdn.html * Plugin info: new tabs for configuration and usage * Danish translation by Birthe (thank you!) * Documentation update * and possibly other cool features I forgot to list here

title: $:/plugins/telmiger/x-tag
author: Thomas Elmiger
name: x-tag
readme:
!! Tags with Superpowers: x-tag

Use the contents of a field to label your tags.

<label>Default field name: <$edit-text tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/x-tag/settings" index="default-label" size="20" tag="input"/></label> – `caption` might be a good choice to start. (The field //title// is used if this is left empty.)


!!! Usage

Default label: `<<x-tag "Tag">>`

Different label: `<<x-tag "Tag" label:"field-name">>`


!!! Styling

Example (label: //caption//) <<x-tag "$:/tags/SideBar" "caption">> vs. the normal tag macro <<tag "$:/tags/SideBar">>

<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/x-tag/styles.css" tag="$:/tags/Stylesheet"> activate special styling for x-tags</$checkbox> via $:/plugins/telmiger/x-tag/styles.css


!!! Display on tiddlers

Activate desired tag types here:

<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/x-tag/ui/ViewTemplate/tags" tag="$:/tags/ViewTemplate"> activate ''x-tag'' display</$checkbox>

<$checkbox tiddler="$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/tags" tag="$:/tags/ViewTemplate"> activate ''standard tag'' display </$checkbox>


!!! Editing

Would you like to see x-tags when editing tiddlers? The //x-tag picker// finds and shows tags labeled by your default field. 

Activate desired elements here:

<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/x-tag/ui/EditTemplate/x-tags" tag="$:/tags/EditTemplate"> activate ''x-tag'' picker</$checkbox>

<$checkbox tiddler="$:/core/ui/EditTemplate/tags" tag="$:/tags/EditTemplate"> activate ''standard tag'' picker</$checkbox>
